alert.note: Alert for McLeod; Nicollet; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 5:59PM CDT until May 30 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR WESTERN SIBLEY...MCLEOD AND NORTH CENTRAL NICOLLET COUNTIES... At 558 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stewart to Winthrop to near New Ulm, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Airport observation. At 545pm a 61 mph wind gust was reported at New Ulm. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Brownton, Stewart, Hutchinson, Silver Lake, Glencoe and Gaylord. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and central Minnesota. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
